result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan M. Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty John Ward.  Court set this hrg based on report which was received from Dr. Rawski.  Atty Ward objects to any further action; the Court found the deft not competent at the previous hrg and is unclear why the case is being heard today.  Atty Ward reports the report from Dr. Rawski just mirrors what Dr. Rawski testified to at the previous hrg.  No further action is taken at this time; case shall remain in suspended status.
Court unavailable the week of January 11th; first day available for the hrg is 1/19/16.
Competency hearing at 01-19-2016 01:15 pm
from Wisc. Forensic Unit - Dr. Rawski
Exhibits D1 and D2 inventoried and stored in Br 1 exhibit room on 6/30/17. To be returned. vm

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
On Competency
Form CR-280
#2 - Forensic Eval

AMENDED BOND
$10,000
Co-signed by RJ
exhibit #2 missing after hrg.  Clerk Lehman contact Atty Ward's office to locate the exhibit
#1 - CV of David Thompson

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty John Ward.  Deft states he is not competent to proceed.  State believes the deft is competent.  Testimony commences - Dr. Rawski (via telephone).  State rests.  Defense case commences.  Testimony Dr. David Thompson.  State stipulates to defense exhibits #1 & #2.  Defense rests.  No further evidence presented by either side.  Arguments heard on whether the deft is competent to proceed.  Court finds the deft is not competent to proceed at this time and is not likely to become competent w/in the time prescribed by law.  The proceedings are suspended.  Court amends deft's bond - No contact w/CCM & KJP and their residences continue.  No contact w/minors unless an adult is present or is related by blood.  Mother shall co-sign the bond.
Competency hearing at 12-08-2015 11:15 am
Forensic Evaluation from Dr. David Thompson
of Filing of Report from Dr. David Thompson
90 day Summary received from Outpatient Competency Restoration Program

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Ward.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Ward states he needs to obtain documents from Dr. Pankiewicz for the independent evaluator to complete his report; was unable to get a Dr to commit until 10/7.  CH continued to 12/2/15 at 1:15pm.

and Summary of Expert Witness
Submitted by Atty John Anthony Ward

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty John Ward.  Report has been received from Dr. Rawski which states the deft has regained competency.  State concurs with the report.  Atty Ward states he believes the deft is barely able to understand these proceedings.  Deft does not agree with the findings.  Court will allow the parties until 10/6/15 to nominate an independent examiner/submit their request(s) to the court.  CH set for 10/21/15 @ 1:15pm

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Jonathan M. Johnson, appeared with Attorney John Anthony Ward.  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Issue of competency, all parties have received the Doctor's Report; discussion held; parties agree DE is not currently competent to proceed. The Court finds the DE is not currently competent to proceed, orders the matter suspended, and orders the DE committed to the care of the Department of Health Services for one year, clerk's office to prepare the paperwork.
from Wisconsin Forensic Unit; copy sent to attys
Order for Competency  Form CR-205

1:11 pm    Atty Jerrold Hinshaw appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney John A Ward.  Clerk:  LE.  Referred to Br. 3 for Compentency hearing.  6-30-15 @ 11;00 am.  Attyi Ward raises issue of competency.  Competency evaluation ordered under 971.14, Miwlaukee Forensic Unit.  Report due in 30 days.  $10,000 signature bond set with conditions.  To be co-signed by parents Roxy J & Gary J.

**  TO BE CO-SIGNED BY PARENTS, Roxy Johnson and Gary Johnson **
  *No Contact w/CCM (dob 10/5/01), KJP (dob 8/6/99, or their residences.  *No unsupervised contact with females under the age of 18.
